intro: Geostachys holttumii, commonly known as the Malabar caryopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Geostachys holttumii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
